echoverse hex stickers


Authors: Brian Schilder, Jack Humphrey, Towfique Raj


Vignette updated: Aug-17-2023

Source: vignettes/make_hex.Rmd
make_hex.Rmd
library(devoptera)

Make hex

devoptera::make_hex is a helper function that generates an echoverse-themed hex sticker using a built-in template.

hex <- devoptera::make_hex(pkg = "devoptera", 
                           save_path = tempfile(fileext = "hex.png"))
## Loading required namespace: hexSticker
## Loading required namespace: R.utils

Show hex

By default, it saves the sticker at inst/hex/hex.png. Once it’s been created, you can push it to the package’s GitHub repository.

This will then be detected automatically by rworkflows::use_badges() when the argument use_hex=TRUE.

rworkflows::use_badges(ref = "RajLabMSSM/devoptera",
                       add_hex = TRUE)
## Finding hex sticker(s) for 1 package(s).
## Adding license.
## Adding version.
## Adding code size
## Adding commit.
## Adding actions.
## Adding codecov.
## Adding authors.



Authors: Brian Schilder, Jack Humphrey, Towfique Raj

(https://github.com/RajLabMSSM/devoptera/workflows/rworkflows/badge.svg)](https://github.com/RajLabMSSM/devoptera/actions)\n

”

Further customisation

For more customised hex stickers, you can make awesome hex stickers for your R packages using:

  • hexSticker
  • ggimage lets you render images as data points.
  • ggpattern lets you fill objects with patterns or images.
  • magick modify PNGs.
